benchmark_details.name: BiMa (Bias Mitigation for Text-Video Retrieval)
benchmark_details.overview: BiMa is a novel framework designed to mitigate biases in both visual and textual representations within text-video retrieval (TVR) systems. It integrates scene elements into video embeddings and introduces a mechanism for disentangling text features into content and bias components, enhancing model performance and robustness against biases.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance generalization and robustness in text-video retrieval by mitigating dataset-specific biases through innovative techniques.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Despite efforts, some inherent biases may remain unmitigated.

data.source: Five major TVR benchmarks: MSR-VTT, MSVD, LSMDC, ActivityNet, and DiDeMo
data.annotation: A comprehensive taxonomy dictionary of scene elements was constructed from multiple datasets.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the rank of retrieved videos in relation to textual queries.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Recall at Rank metrics indicate better performance in retrieving relevant videos to the provided textual queries.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison with existing benchmarks demonstrates BiMa achieving state-of-the-art results across multiple datasets.
methodology.validation: Validated through extensive experiments and ablation studies measuring performance improvements.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Does not include analysis related to demographics; the focus is on bias mitigation in a general sense.
harm: Model overfitting to specific biases in datasets.
